ygData.subject: Re: Smithing and "spoilers"
ygData.msgSnippet: PLEASE do not fall into this trap. I personally do not care about so-called spoilers . I would not be reading this list if I did not want info about the game.
ygData.messageBody:
PLEASE do not fall into this trap. I personally do not care about so-called
"spoilers". I would not be reading this list if I did not want info about
the game. The game absurdly poorly documented, making things like this list
a god send. Here I can learn things that otherwise would take me pointless
hours of frustration that could be spent actually having fun in the game.

I personally will post any and all useful information here that I think
will help all of you have more fun with the game. I strongly encourage
everyone else to do the same. If you don't like "spoilers" (in other words
if figuring stuff out on your own is part of the fun to you) then simply
don't read the material here.

So Jyzan here asks a great question, one which I would like to know the
answer to, since I have been looking for ore for ages. I now know I can buy
it in Steamfont, and I am hoping there is somewhere on the mainland I can
buy it.

So if someone knows the answer, don't send it privately to Jyzan, send it
to all of us so that those of us who want to smith don't spend HOURS
looking for ore (which is NOT fun to me, I don't know about anyone else).

-Musil

RP Note: In a role-play sense it is perfectly legitimate to tell an
aspiring smith a few tricks of the trade, and where to go to purchase his
supplies and practice his art.


At 07:55 AM 5/7/99 , you wrote:
>From: "John Robertson" <johnr@...>
>
>Greetings all!
>
>Could someone here tell me locations to buy ore, besides the windmill in
Steamfont?
>
>Email me privately at johnr@... if you think the rest of the list
does not want to
>see this (they probably don't).
>
>Thanks.
>
>Jyzan
